intro: Ornithogalum immaculatum, commonly known as the white star lily, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant produces striking white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are long, narrow, and grass-like, forming a dense rosette at the base. Ornithogalum immaculatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade.
